其實我唔贊成因為人口老化而鼓勵生育。

短期嚟講，一個人由出世去到成為勞動人口至少要成二十年。但人口老化問題而家已經好嚴重，遠水救唔到近火。
同埋生育率上升，意味住政府除咗要撥資源俾老人嘅同時，亦要喺幼兒配套等方面增加資源，令政府財政負擔更加重。而勞動人口一方面又要照顧年邁嘅長輩，另一方面又要湊細路，負擔亦會好大。

現實係而家嘅幼兒設施已經嚴重不足，你見新聞透視話啲家長由仔女未出世就開始排託兒所，但就排到幾歲都未排到就知。
啲幼兒園/幼稚園又係要好早好早開始報定，遲少少報都話冇位。鼓勵生育咪盞令到個問題進一步惡化。

長遠嚟講，小朋友第日都會老，鼓勵生育令未來又有好多老人家，又有人口老化問題。令人口老化再次出現，造成惡性循環。而香港人囗過盛呢個問題亦永遠都舒緩唔到。

自己都未養掂重養仔
住都沒得住點生
首先要有女

Okay. Population is a huge topic, and some of its branches are within my expertise, so I will talk briefly.

1. Are we obligated to keep the current population size?
No. There is no economic reason for this. The economy has been shifting towards an input combination of high-skilled labor and capitals, since the first Industrial Revolution. The huge population of China and India may not be a blessing but a curse.
We should instead to shift resources to educate people and lift poverty. Please be acknowledged that many people are not receiving adequate and appropriate education due to poverty. And thus they are not producing the value that can lift their poverty status, or worthy in the general human sense. Their offspring inherited their socioeconomic status and trapped in this viscous cycle. The society would be much better, if resources are allocated to educate a smaller population then to feed the current population. Actually that's what China has been adopting since the one child policy.

2. Low fertility caused population aging?
No. It is not irrelevant, but far from the true cause. This is really a wide-spread myth.
As said, production mode is being reformed, we need not huge amount of unskilled labors to promote economic growth. Giving birth to more infants may work in individual household sense, but socially, the government and education system just can't afford that everyone is bearing more. The current fertility rate, at the first glance, seems reasonable.
The true cause is, after the two world wars, people bore too much. This is known as the baby-booms. The problem is particularly severe in China, as they had propagated "population is an advantage of communism". While one child policy is generally successful, it is just compensating their previous mistakes. The vast amount of baby-boomers actually created another baby-boom when they reached the age of developing their own family.
As said, these baby-boomers are simply too much. They are uneducated, burning up resources of the next generations, and causing social burden when they retire. That is blunt but truthful.

3. What can we do?
The mistakes are made by our grandparents' generation, and of course we cannot ask for the dying people for the compensating measures.
Fortunately, this problem is tough but not something unbearable.
Firstly, not to repeat the mistakes. No more fertile pigs.
Secondly, on the basis to lesser fertility rate, take care of our parents more, or the government tax more to feed them. Both are double-edged, but undoubtedly an improvement than wasting resources on the excessive children.
Thirdly, education. Educate the next generation better so that they are at the right track. I am not mentioning it enough. Education is much more important than fertilization.
In addition, the current tax allowance is a joke. What a stupid recessive taxing policy. Almost wrong in every aspect.
Much more details should be added, but the general structure is the above.

TL;DR
Should not. We should bear less instead.
